intro: Brachyramphus intybaceus, commonly known as the short-billed murrelet, is a small seabird belonging to the family Procellariidae. It is characterized by its compact body, short wings, and a distinctive, pale bill. This species is primarily found in the northern Pacific Ocean, breeding on rocky shores and islands. The bird has a grayish-brown plumage that provides excellent camouflage in its coastal habitat. It is an opportunistic feeder, consuming a variety of small fish and invertebrates.
